remarks: In a lattice, joins distribute over meets if and only if meets distribute over joins; the distributive property is self-dual. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 29-Jan-2015.)
statement:
latdisd.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
latdisd.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
latdisd.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
latdisd $p |- ( K e. Lat -> ( A. x e. B A. y e. B A. z e. B ( x .\/ ( y ./\ z ) ) = ( ( x .\/ y ) ./\ ( x .\/ z ) ) <-> A. x e. B A. y e. B A. z e. B ( x ./\ ( y .\/ z ) ) = ( ( x ./\ y ) .\/ ( x ./\ z ) ) ) ) $.
$d ./\ x y z $.
$d .\/ x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d K x y z $.
